snippet: Federal safety regulators pushed the company to expand the recall as parents complained that they had to cut the straps to remove their children.
abstract: Graco Children’s Products is recalling almost 3.8 million car seats because faulty buckles can make it hard to free the child in an emergency; National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, in unusual move, says that action does not go far enough and tells Graco that unless company recalls additional 1.8 million seats that use same buckles it will take legal action to force them to do so.
lead_paragraph: Federal safety regulators pushed the company to expand the recall as parents complained that they had to cut the straps to remove their children.

headline.main: Graco Recalls Car Seats Over Faulty Buckle
headline.print_headline: Graco Recalls Car Seats Over Faulty Buckle
